坐敷: (ざしき) - tatami room/tatami mat room/formal Japanese room; dinner party in a tatami room (esp. when a geisha or maiko attends)
坐礁: (ざしょう) - running aground; being stranded
坐禅: (ざぜん) - zazen (seated Zen meditation, usu. in a cross-legged position)
坐繰り: (ざぐり) - (座繰り, 坐繰り only) reeling by hand (esp. silk)/hand filature; (esp. 座ぐり) counter sinking (making conical depression so screw-heads don't protrude above surface)/spot facing (machining a flat space for bolt head, etc.)/spotfacing; (esp. 座刳り) hollowing out (e.g. wooden chair seat, scallop pattern on roof, etc.)
坐蒲: (ざふ) - round cushion used for Zen meditation (traditionally made of woven bulrush leaves)
坐蒲団: (ざぶとん) - zabuton (flat floor cushion used when sitting or kneeling; usu. rectangular)
坐視: (ざし) - remaining an idle spectator; looking on unconcernedly (doing nothing)
